Message.Title: AAPL Must Want to ACQUIRE YAHOO
Message.Msg: First, AAPL can easily afford to acquire YHOO. It will be a form of horizontal integration for AAPL -- something AAPL has indicated a need for. And it gives AAPL a low-cost entry into also becoming a large internet company. I believe AAPL will beat MSFT to the punch that acquires YHOO. So how imminent is this likely event? IT COULD HAPPEN at any time. YHOO's cash and foreign assets make it more attractive than its price indicates.

Message.Title: Alibaba to Appoint New CFO Ahead of Anticipated IPO
Message.Msg: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. named a new chief financial officer as part of a management reorganization that has fueled speculation China’s largest e- commerce company is preparing for an initial public offering. Alibaba will promote deputy CFO Maggie Wu to replace Joseph Tsai on May 10, the same day billionaire Jack Ma relinquishes the post of chief executive officer, according to a company statement yesterday. Tsai will become executive vice chairman and oversee strategic investment. Her appointment is part of the preparation for an initial share sale, Yip said.

Message.Title: Could we see a takeover war between Aapl and Msft for Yahoo?
Message.Msg: I think the chances are good we could and let me explain why. Msft under Ballmer has been a disaster. Windows 8 is a disaster and Microsoft stock has been in decline or flat for years. No new products coming from Microsoft and it appears the company will have to do some radical to shake things up. If Microsoft doesn't do something quick, Google, Apple and other will walk away with the prize and Msft dies on the vine. Time for Msft to buy out Yahoo and live for another day then do nothing and fade into the sunset. Apple stock has gone for $700 down to $430. Ouch. Cook spend more time apologizing to China officials about iPhone warranty then shareholder concerns. Apple won't be coming out with new products for 4 to 6 months and we all know Facebook just did an end around with Googles android. Apple needs to find new synergy, branch out and take on Google in other areas. Bottom line Apple future is very likely a Yahoo takeover.

Message.Title: UBS UPGRADEto $77 IS IT A TYPO or for real?
Message.Msg: A week ago UBS Upgrade YHOO to $77 From $27 Many articles from different financial news still show the same with no correction bet the upgrade isn't a typo at all! ""Yahoo! (NASDAQ: YHOO) was upgraded by research analysts at UBS AG from a “market perform” rating to an “outperform” rating in a report released on Thursday. The firm currently has a $77.00 target price on the stock, up from their previous target price of $27.00. Shares of Yahoo! (NASDAQ: YHOO) traded up 3.21% during mid-day trading on Thursday, hitting $22.805. Yahoo! has a 52 week low of $14.59 and a 52 week high of $23.09. The stock’s 50-day moving average is currently $21.3. The company has a market cap of $25.115 billion and a P/E ratio of 6.74"".

Topic.Title: Alibaba to Appoint New CFO Ahead of Anticipated IPO

Message.Msg: Sept 18, 2012 Alibaba said Tuesday it completed an initial repurchase of about half of Yahoo's 40% stake, netting Yahoo about $4.3 billion after taxes and fees. Yahoo said it would return about $3.65 billion of that amount to shareholders, contrary to recent speculation that it might use the sizable proceeds to make acquisitions or take other strategic action. Under terms of the deal, Yahoo is receiving about $6.3 billion in cash, $800 million in preferred stock in Alibaba and $550 million as a result of amending the firms' technology and intellectual-property licensing agreement. Alibaba said it has the right to repurchase half of Yahoo's remaining stake.

Message.Title: Thank you Dan Loeb & Marissa Mayer
Message.Msg: When Dan Loeb rocked the boat last year, just before Marissa came on board, I knew that this Yahoo stock with 700,000,000 Unique Viewers, the number one sight for sports (bigger than ESPN), and the number one site for Investors (bigger than CNBC, Bloomberg...) just was a frigging gold mine so under valued that if four screwy CEO's couldn't destroy it, nothing could. But last summer, it became very apparent that the Investor himself, Mr. Loeb, was calling the shots, so I began jumping in at the $14 range and even in the low $15's. And then POW! Here came Marissa! OMG! Alibaba IPO. Mobilizing. Monetizing. Advertising. Flickerizing. Possible Daily Motionizing. I took a big gambe and bought big and I thank Loeb and Mayer for making me a big pile of serious money. So am I going sell now? No way. This movie has just begun. Wait until the bidding war for Yahoo begins. And it will. Happy. Are you? YAHOO!!!!!
